topic.title: DP TCP UHBR20 Barlow Ridge Topology

fig.title: DP TCP UHBR20 Barlow Ridge Topology Diagram

image.href: FIG_dp tcp uhbr20 barlow ridge topology diagram_1.jpg

table.title: DP TCP UHBR20 Barlow Ridge Topology Notes

entry.p: Microstrip main route routing must be interleaved.
To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Nominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to Barlow Ridge pins
17 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

section.title: Mainstream, Tx, Post-Channel

table.title: DP TCP UHBR20 Barlow Ridge Topology Mainstream, Tx, Post-Channel Routing Guidelines

section.p: Max Length Total Note: Refer to Barlow Ridge guidelines

section.title: Mainstream, Tx, Pre-Channel

table.title: DP TCP UHBR20 Barlow Ridge Topology Mainstream, Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines

section.p: Max Length Total Note: Max length can be increased up to 220mm (M1+M2 = 212mm), if more than 90% of the channel is routed as stripline.
